w:r.w:t: The student will be introduced to numbers 6-10. The student will be able to recognize numbers 6-10 and will be able to count various objects up to ten. Knowing how to count and respond with number answers will help expand basic vocabulary. They will also b
e able to write number and word form up to ten.
At the completion of this lesson, the student will be able to:
Recognize, spell, and pronounce numbers and their associated word names: 6,7,8,9,10 (six, seven, eight, nine, ten)
Spell and pronounce commonly associated words
Word List: 6, 7, 8, 9, 10, six, seven, eight, nine, ten
This slide will always be the
-branded opener slide that the teacher will display as the student enters the classroom.
Greet your student and introduce the lesson concept: Today, we are going to learn how to count from six to ten: 6, 7, 8, 9, 10
Hold up fingers to signify each number
One minute for a quick check of background knowledge to determine how much extension should be used with the lesson.
